title: Fix missing TransactionList and HolderList component rendering

requirements.summary: Restore the TransactionList component to render the last 100 transactions with pagination (25 per page) fetched from the backend getIndexedTransactions method
acceptanceCriteria: TransactionList component file contains implementation to fetch and display transactions
Component renders a table or list showing transaction data with columns for relevant fields (from/to addresses, amount, timestamp)
Pagination controls display 25 transactions per page with ability to navigate between pages
Component uses the useTransactions hook or equivalent to fetch data from backend getIndexedTransactions method
Component appears on the page below the indexing status alert

file_operations.description: Implement TransactionList component to display transactions in a table with pagination. Create a card component that fetches transaction data using the useTransactions hook, displays it in a sortable table with columns for transaction ID, from address, to address, amount, fee, status, and timestamp. Include pagination controls to show 25 transactions per page. Apply the gold-themed styling consistent with HolderList component. Handle loading and error states gracefully.

requirements.summary: Implement the useTransactions hook to fetch transaction data from the backend getIndexedTransactions method using React Query
acceptanceCriteria: Hook file contains implementation that uses React Query to call backend actor's getIndexedTransactions method
Hook returns transaction data, loading state, and error state
Hook includes appropriate refetch interval to keep transaction data updated
Hook handles pagination state if needed for the 25 transactions per page requirement

file_operations.description: Implement useTransactions hook that wraps the useGetIndexedTransactions query hook. Returns transaction data array, loading state, and error state. The hook should enable automatic refetching at regular intervals (e.g., every 30 seconds) to keep transaction data fresh. Include basic error handling for failed queries.

Add a new React Query hook called useGetIndexedTransactions that calls actor.getIndexedTransactions() method. Configure it with appropriate staleTime and refetchInterval settings (similar to existing useGetHolderData hook pattern). This hook should return the transaction array from the backend and handle the query key invalidation when the actor changes.

requirements.summary: Add the TransactionList component to the App.tsx component below the indexing status alert and above the VideoSection component
acceptanceCriteria: TransactionList component is imported in App.tsx
Component is rendered in the JSX structure positioned after the indexing alert and before the VideoSection
Component receives proper styling and spacing to maintain visual consistency with other sections

file_operations.description: Import TransactionList component at the top of the file. Insert the TransactionList component in the JSX structure after the indexing status alert (the yellow alert about indexing) and before the VideoSection component. Wrap it in appropriate spacing/container div to maintain consistent spacing with other sections on the page.

requirements.summary: Debug and fix the HolderList component rendering issue to ensure it displays on the page with the fetched holder data from the backend
acceptanceCriteria: HolderList component is properly imported and rendered in App.tsx
Component successfully fetches data using the useHolderData hook
Component displays holder table with columns for address, balance, and percentage of total supply
Component shows appropriate loading states while fetching data
Component handles error states gracefully if data fetch fails
Component appears on the page in its designated position

file_operations.description: Verify that HolderList component is properly imported and rendered in the JSX. Check that it is positioned correctly in the component tree and not accidentally hidden by CSS or conditional rendering logic. Ensure the component receives proper spacing and layout. If the component is missing from the render tree, add it back in the appropriate position with proper container styling.

Review and fix any rendering issues in the HolderList component. Verify that the useHolderData hook is called correctly and that loading/error states are handled properly. Ensure the component renders the table structure correctly with proper mapping over the holders array. Check that the sorting logic works and that percentage calculations display correctly. Fix any console errors or warnings that might prevent rendering.
